resources.string: Without them, all of this wouldn’t be possible
View the timeline of the event.

Right from its inception in 2009, the ACM VIT Student Chapter has been organizing and conducting successful technical and professional development events. ACM-VIT is a non-profit organization of talented individuals specialising in several domains of technology like WebDev, AppDev, Machine Learning, AR/VR, CyberSec and many more. Technology is its cause and education its objective, which we achieve by conducting exciting and informative events all year round with Code2Create being our grandest event.

Code2Create is ACM-VIT’s flagship event and one of the grandest annual events hosted in VIT. A thrilling tech sprint awaited by numerous innovators, Code2Create witnesses a plethora of skill sets. Code2Create is a place where graphic designers, software developers, app and web developers collaborate intensively on projects. Participants from across the country indulge in 36 hours of intense brainstorming, designing, creating and testing, along with some engaging and very enjoyable side quests.
How do I submit my work?
You can submit your projects on our portal: c2c.acmvit.in/projects
Who will own the Intellectual Property Rights of the product developed by my team?

The Intellectual Property Rights belong solely to your team until your team decides to enter into an agreement with a third party company in which case the Intellectual Property Rights will be divided equally between the company(Party 1) and your team(Party 2).
How many reviews will be there?
here will be two elimination rounds - On 8th and 9th respectively. The top 6 teams will get a chance to present their hack in the final Expo.
What is the weightage of each review?

For the 1st review we will make note of your chosen track with understanding and innovation you have shown related to the chosen problem statement. The 2nd review is a technical review where you will be judged based on your implementation.
Yes you will get loads of yummy food to fill your bellies with!
What do I do if I want to rest?
You can relax in CS Hall and participate in one of the many fun activities to refresh your mind.
Who is on the Judging Panel?
There will be one judging panel comprising of three judges.
Can we work on our own problem statements?
Of course! As long as your problem statement is relevant to one of the tracks provided, you are free to work on any problem statement to your liking.
What do I do if I need an internet connection?
You will be provided with free access to our beloved internet facility, VOLSBB.
What will we be judging criterion?
The criterion for evaluations are: Simplicity, Design, Solution to real time problem, Technology and Feasibility as a product.
Who do I contact if I face any problems?
You can call anyone from the organizing team. We will be happy to help!
